itemDescription: British curler and association football player (1865-1918)

wikipedia_page.main: Robert Main Christie (15 November 1865 – 15 May 1918), sometimes known as Bob Christie, was a Scottish amateur footballer who played as an outside forward, most notably for Queen's Park. He later became president of the SFA and represented Scotland at curling.

response: *Robert Christie (Ontario politician), member of the Ontario provincial parliament, 1867–1874
*Robert Christie (Quebec politician) (1787–1856), historian and political figure from the Gaspé region of Quebec
Christie was the younger brother of international footballer Robert Christie.
* Robert Christie, Alex Christie (brother)Robert Main Christie: Dunblane’s original sporting hero, The Scotsman, 24 April 2014
